This artefact, which resembles the human eye, considerably increases metabolism of the body, helping wounds heal quicker. Experienced stalkers say that Eye also brings luck. Irrespective of the validity of that statement, its positive effects are indeed quite potent. 
		
This artefact soothes the pain and is extremely useful when treating wounds.
		
When worn, it is known to slightly counter harmful effects of psy-anomalies or psy-waves of certain mutants.
		
These beneficial qualities, however, come at a price. This artefact is extremely dangerous when exposed to chemical anomalies as it amplifies their toxicity and increases their potency. It is hence highly recommended to keep the artefact in your backpack, never on the body, when exploring toxic areas unless you have a death wish.
		
The artefact is also known colloquially as "copper eye" as it conducts electricity and amplifies its dangerous effects in the same way as copper does. 
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.

This artefact forms in areas of high thermal activity. Produces powerful infrared emissions which intensify metabolic processes, healing wounds before its bearer's very eyes.
		
Its healing capabilities are even stronger than in case of the Eye as stalkers in possession of this artefact are said to have survived being wounded by chimeras. Thanks to that, it has earned the reputation of a miraculous artefact.
		
Many stalkers owe it their lives, and most veteran mutant hunters carry it in case they run into danger. However, it shares not only positive but also negative properties of its cousin: entering a psy-field with this artefact on the belt is suicide. It will absorb psy energy and emitting it at a considerable rate.
		
Also, it is highly advised to proceed with caution when planning to bring the artefact to the market as prolonged exposure to even minimal amounts of radioactive materials can result in death of the user.
		
It can also be used as a reusable medkit of sorts since it heals wounds very quickly.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.

One should take note, however, that this artefact hinders blood clotting and increases bleeding rate of open wounds. On the other hand, being a powerful resistor, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electricity.
		
Being an artefact of electric nature, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electricity. On the contrary, it should be noted that Battery absorbs heat and is able to convey it to other objects.

Shell is composed of two disk of bluish colour connected by semitransparent material of unknown nature.
		
This strange artefact was considered devoid of any useful properties by many scientists for a long time. Only recently has it been discovered that it is indeed quite beneficial.
		
When the artefact comes into contact with the body, it will make one feel rejuvenated and thus it increases stamina recovery. This effect has in case of some stalkers induced hyperactivity. One downside of this artefact, however, is that it reduces the number of platelets in blood, thus increasing bleeding rate.
		
It provides a considerable level of psy protection and absorbs electromagnetic interference, acting as a grounding material.
		
It will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust. Caution must be taken when approaching heat sources with this artefact.
		
Shell is extremely light and very portable.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.

Also colloquially known as "Radioactive Snowflake". At first glance, this artefact resembles a white Kolobok.
		
Thanks to its unique properties, the artefact can significantly increase the bearer's muscle tone, thus greatly improving stamina recovery. Due to its high radioactivity, stalkers in possession of it are sometimes jokingly referred to as "Radioactive Snowflakes".
		
When faced with the decision whether to carry it on the belt during a mission, you have to carefully weigh its pros and cons: does it pay to have greater endurance and high protection against electricity at the cost of being constantly exposed to its deadly radiation? Even if you are determined to take it with you, it should be noted that it is not to be used on long excursions to the Zone.
		
Snowflake, however, holds a big downside: it interacts with surrounding energy sources by absorbing and amplifying their effects. For this reason, approaching heat sources, toxic areas and psy-fields while holding this artefact is a suicide.
		
It is as light as a snowflake and very easy to carry around.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.

This artefact resembles melted cheese interspersed with sapphire-like stones. Only yellow outer shell of the artefact appears to give off radiation and by careful processing it is possible to extract the non-radioactive blue parts for jewellery and other industrial purposes. This is due to the fact that if cleaned properly and polished, sapphire comparison becomes much more explicit: the stones are as hard and durable as this beautiful gem. This quality of theirs and their appearance make them perfect gemstones and jewellers all over the world strive to have them in stock. 
		\nThe usefulness of the artefact, however, is not limited to its industrial applications. There is scientific evidence suggesting that sapphire-like stones effectively protect from psy-waves, whereas the outer shell slightly increases resistance to toxicity.
		\nHowever, it can cause objects in its vicinity to heat up and in extreme cases to ignite along with the artefact. For this reason, it is safe to conclude that it absorbs heat and is able to convey it to other objects.
		\nDue to its density the weight of artefact has increased beyond normal standards, and thus it is one of the heaviest anomalous creations in the Zone.

Also colloquially known as "Radioactive Snowflake". At first glance, this artefact resembles a white Kolobok.
		\nThanks to its unique properties, the artefact can significantly increase the bearer's muscle tone, thus greatly improving stamina recovery. Due to its high radioactivity, stalkers in possession of it are sometimes jokingly referred to as "Radioactive Snowflakes".
		\nWhen faced with the decision whether to carry it on the belt during a mission, you have to carefully weigh its pros and cons: does it pay to have greater endurance and high protection against electricity at the cost of being constantly exposed to its deadly radiation? Even if you are determined to take it with you, it should be noted that it is not to be used on long excursions to the Zone.
		\nSnowflake, however, holds a big downside: it interacts with surrounding energy sources by absorbing and amplifying their effects. For this reason, approaching heat sources, toxic areas and psy-fields while holding this artefact is a suicide.
		\nIt is as light as a snowflake and very easy to carry around.
		\n \nRadiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.\n \n

Soul is a unique organic artefact with properties just as unique: it secretes slimy goo that dramatically increases recovery rate of wounds. Thanks to its reasonable price and attractive appearance, this artefact is a valuable collector's item.
		\nApplying its gooey substance to wounds will soothes the pain and speeds up healing process. 
		\It also reduces the effects of psy-waves and their damage to one's brain. But it should be known that Soul drains power from its user. The artefact does not have high density and thus is not very heavy.
		\n \nRadiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.\n \n

A relatively rare artefact forming in chemical areas, Kolobok is highly valued for its ability to heal most kinds of wounds and stop bleeding in a matter of minutes.
		\nFor unknown reasons, scientists are spreading rumours among stalkers that the artefact modifies bearer's genetic code, which is unproven and should be regarded as conscious attempt at monopolizing the supply of the artefact by the scientific community. This does not, however, mean that it is completely harmless.
		\nOne drawback of this artefact is the fact that it will interact to radioactive particles, so it is best to avoid radiation fields when in possession of the artefact, especially since its negative effects are not balanced with positive ones. It will also reduce energy recovery, which is the result of its sharp needle-like appendages. The needles cause small and quickly healing wounds which bring constant pain and itch, thus reducing stamina.
		\nThis artefact also weakens protection against heat and acids due to its high flammability. 
		\nLightweight and not too much of a burden to carry around.
		\nRadiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.\n \n

Firefly interacts with fields unknown to science, considerably speeding up regeneration of tissue and organs in living beings, as well as normalizing metabolic processes.
		\nThis artefact can literally get a badly wounded stalker back on his feet in a matter of minutes. On the other hand, Firefly can spontaneously combust when exposed to potent radioactive sources.
		\nA big downside to this artefact is that it weakens the body and reduce the number of platelets in blood during heal process, thus increasing bleeding rate.
		\nIt seems to drain stamina and decrease stamina recovery greatly as well. Some of those who used Firefly for its healing purposes have reported that they couldn't walk for hours afterwards.
		\nUnfortunately, Firefly is extremely rare.
		\nRadiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.\n \n

A very rare artefact. It's been several years since one was found.
		\nIt can locate gaps in anomaly fields. It is believed that it can help one traverse the most complex anomaly fields completely unharmed. However, very few know how to handle it properly.
		\nThe Compass showed few unique properties under last experiments. It can interact to moving objects, causing some to completely disappear. Or perhaps teleport?
		\nIt also weakens the body by draining stamina and increasing bleeding rate constantly. But the biggest draw however, is the dangerous radiation output this artefact emits comparing to the artefact radiation scale.
		\nHolding this artefact near the body will cause death in matter of few minutes.\n \n

This artefact was found at the centre of the legendary Oasis. It appears that the Heart is a crystallised plant, which has acquired the healing properties of the Oasis.
		\nNot only it dramatically increases recovery rate of wounds and healing process, but also provides the body with strong source of energy. It is a true miracle.
		\nThat being said, the Oasis is very sensitive to outer sources of energy and surrounding environment. For this reason, interacting with anomaly fields will bring death to the holder.

"Big, red and cursed."
		\nThis is how the locals prefer to describe the Death Lamp, while some refer to it as the "Seed of Satan". Many traders believe the rumours surrounding the artefact, thus refusing to buy it.
		Little is known about its origins, and nothing of value has been discovered so far.
		\nDeath Lamp was first discovered few years ago by a group of three experienced stalkers. Shortly after delivering the artefact to the Ecologists in Yantar, two of them found dead with a horrific expression on their faces. Nothing is known about the fate of the third stalker.
		\nFollowing the accident, members of the science team who studied the artefact had reported having nightmare disorder in the days to follow.
		\nApart from the mysterious effects, the artefact drains vitality and willpower from the user, often on such a scale that it induces dizziness and in extreme cases causes the user to faint. 
		\n \nRadiation output is highest on the artefact radiation scale.\n \n

PFM-1 (short for ��������������� �������� ����; NATO name: "Green parrot") used to be a standard-issue anti-personnel mine of the Red Army, employed mainly during the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan. Its widespread utilisation during the conflict led to high civilian casualties, especially among children, since randomly scattered mines were often mistaken for toys due to their familiar shape and colour. For this reason, the PFM-1 earned a sinister nickname: "Child killer." Since then, the mine has been replaced by newer models. However, as was the case with a variety of other 'retired' weaponry, a large number of these mines has somehow made its way into the Zone, becoming its primary booby-trap explosive. The mine is highly valued mainly for its functionality, user-friendliness, compact size and low weight, while its main drawback is a relatively small amount of explosive material: its power is often insufficient to kill a heavily armoured stalker with a single blast. For this reason, the mine should be used in combination with other explosive materials and it acts as an igniter. If it is not armed, the mine will not detonate, even when hit with a gun.

Improvised explosive device (based on OG-7V warhead)

Improvised explosive device based on OG-7V warhead and parts of a car battery. It looks like it has been carried around for quite some time and could go off any second. Fortunately, the triggering mechanism ensures that it won't unless the explosive is directly hit by a bullet or subjected to other potent physical force. In the Zone, IEDs are quite popular and Zoners use them for a variety of purposes, from gaining access to closed areas to ambushes. They are also often placed next to mines to greatly amplify the power of explosion. IED can be effectively concealed making it virtually invisible to everyone else.

		%c[ui_gray_1]Heavy metal gas balloon impregnated with compatible polymer on the inside and on the outside with Hypalon for weather abrasion and UV resistance. This gas holder balloon is a collapsible, intermediated storage tank for any industrial gas, prior to bottling under pressure. In the Zone such canisters most often contain a composition of methane, propane, ethane and butane, and can be used for cooking or heating as well as for combat purposes. Upon direct gunfire, the canister may ignite and after a short while a rapid release of a considerable amount of energy may follow, causing the gas in the balloon to expand instantly and resulting in a delayed but powerful explosion with metal shrapnel going in every direction. Such canisters have been utilised as a weapon in the feuds between factions in the Zone killing many and crippling even more. If emptied, the balloon can be utilised for armour repairs.

%c[d_red]WARNING: Explodes upon impact
 

		%c[ui_gray_1]A large metal can filled with E95 gasoline. Jerrycans were brought to the Zone in large quantities by the Ukrainian military for their armoured vehicles. Initially, they served their purpose, but after the second Chernobyl Disaster vehicles for reasons still unknown were no longer operational. While some Zoners are still trying to make the wrecks work again, others have found alternate ways of utilising the jerrycans, namely, as improvised explosives. Upon direct hit, the canister will catch fire and explode after a slight delay. Although heavy and cumbersome, it is extremely powerful, and a well-placed jerrycan can be lethal even if the target wears the heaviest of body armours. On the other hand, the explosion is often so potent that the killer becomes the victim himself, so it's best to use these canisters with caution. There are rumours that a veteran stalker named Yuya once saved his skin by luring a pseudogiant into a jerrycan trap. He emptied his last Makarov magazine and the giant burst into flames with a roar that was heard throughout the Jupiter.

Epinephrine (also known as adrenalin) is a hormone and a neurotransmitter. Epinephrine has many functions in the body, instantly regulating heart rate, blood vessel and air passage diameters, and metabolic shifts. Epinephrine release is a crucial component of the fight-or-flight response of the sympathetic nervous system. The effects lead to increased blood glucose and fatty acids, providing substrates for instant energy production within cells throughout the body.

An iron ampoule designed as field equipment for military field personnel for instant pain reduction. It contains a powerful dose of metamizole mixed with an antihemorrhagic drug. Metamizole is one of the strongest Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs (NSAIDs), especially effective at easing aches and pains as well as reducing fevers. It is also useful as anti-inflammatory drug when used in higher doses. May cause some delayed side effects such as leucopenia or agranulocytosis, so it should be used with moderation. Injected into an arm or a thigh. Its availability in the Zone is limited due to the difficulty of smuggling the medicine across military cordons.

A substance functioning as a radioprotector, used to weaken the effects of radiation on the body. The radioprotective effect of cystamine is based on the ability to bind free radicals - ionised and excited molecules formed in tissues upon irradiation - as well as the ability of the drug to interact with certain enzymes and impart resistance to ionising radiation. The effects of cystamine do not counteract already accumulated radiation.

Sulfanilamide medication, effective against gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. It acts on pneumococci, streptococci, staphylococcus, E. coli, Klebsiella stick (Friedlander's stick), causative agents of dysentery; is less active with respect to the protein; is active against the trachoma virus (an infectious eye disease that can lead to blindness); It does not act on strains of bacteria resistant to other sulfanilamide preparations. Adverse effects include headaches, digestive disorders, skin rashes, fevers and leukopenia. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

 Chlorotetracycline hydrochloride has a bacteriostatic effect on gram-positive and gram-negative microbes, rickettsia and some large viruses.

Tablets coated with a shell, containing 4.6 and 10 mg of perphenazine. The drug is a neuroleptic - an antipsychotic agent that provides antiallergic, sedative, miorelaxing, antiemetic, weak anticholinergic, hypotensive and hypothermic actions. The efficacy of Etperazine is due to the blockade of D2 receptors in the mesocortical and mesolimbic systems. Rarely used in the Zone.

Tetanus vaccine is composed of inactivated tetanus toxin and is used to prevent an individual from contracting tetanus. Tetanus, also known as lockjaw, is a disease caused by the bacteria Clostridium tetani which enter the body through open wounds and release a poison called tetanospasmin. Tetanus is a potentially deadly disease because the poison attacks the nervous system blocking nerve signals from the spinal cord to and from the muscles. Animals and mutants alike are prone to carry Clostridium tetani which can be transferred through bites. Injection of inactivated toxin enhances your immunological system and can lead to several positive side-effects. Moreover, this vaccine has been supplemented with several additional anti-toxins making it usable for purposes other than preventing contraction of tetanus.

A severed hand of a fracture - an extremely deformed humanoid mutant. It is certain that these creatures used to be humans and that they are the direct result of the second Chernobyl incident. From the remains of their clothing we can deduce that fractures originate from prisoner population that was stationed in the Exclusion Zone and sentenced to forced labour. Since all fractures suffer almost the same type of deformation of the body, it is supposed that when the exposure took place all subjects were in the same body position - either because they were being transported at the time or because someone forced them. All specimens encountered so far were male and sterile. Hence it can be safely assumed that the fracture population is unable to reproduce, and their number in the Zone will be steadily dwindling. For this reason, at present they remain one of the most rarely encountered types of mutant. The right hand of a fracture is a valuable research object.

This is a hand of a creature called old zombie - former human beings who lived or worked in the Exclusion Zone and were subjected to extreme amounts of radiation and psy-influence when the second Chernobyl incident occurred. After many years of being in this state, they possess only a frail body with bones and half-rotten flesh clearly visible. For this reason, the creatures very much resemble re-animated dead bodies, however they are very much alive and almost permanently hungry and thus can become a threat when encountered in packs. Severed hand not only constitutes a scientific research material but in many cases can also be used to identify the person to whom the hand belonged.

The horn of a chimera. Its exact molecular composition is unknown, but we know for a fact that its tip is as durable and sharp as a diamond, which explains why the beast is able to cut through armour with ease. This item is in high demand as it is visibly similar to a rhino horn. Rumour has it that once upon a time a few poachers arrived in the Zone with the aim of acquiring the horn and selling it on the black market. To their surprise, however, chimeras did not make such easy targets as rhinos, so the poachers were never heard from again. All that remains of them are some unpleasant memories and belongings which indicate where they must have been ripped to pieces by these vicious mutants. Chimera�s horn can also be used as a crude sharpening tool, but utmost caution should be exercised because it can break, preventing the careless stalker from selling this valuable specimen.

An eye of the pseudogiant has the appearance of a larger human eye, but with a few differences. It has a multi-coloured iris and its tear glands are exceptionally well-developed. Pseudogiants are known to lacrimate profusely and regularly, but we don't know whether this is a result of some physiological process or a by-product of the psychology of the creature. In any case, the scientists would be very eager to lay their hands on it, so they're willing to pay a high price for any specimen.

While many stalkers consider crows no more than pests, more insightful ones acknowledge their usefulness in tackling the many challenges the Zone presents. While murders of crows can prove invaluable navigating and evading danger on the empty streets of Chernobyl and Pripyat, it's only after their death when their true value is manifested.
 
The population of crows grows constantly in spite of the increased knowledge of usefulness of their beaks. It seems accelerated adaptation, typical among Zone's fauna, has provided them with a sped-up reproduction cycle resulting in up to 4 egg lays a year. Their prolonged life-span, of up to 20 years, has given them extraordinary intelligence manifested especially when many crows are in proximity.
 
This last effect has led to a rather peculiar custom among the some of the Zone-dwellers which - as rumor has it - was introduced by the very first Stalkers who arrived in the Zone after the Second Incident. The ritual - aptly referred to as "The Beak" - involves taking a pulverized beak from the eldest crow in the murder and creating a special mixture. When the concoction is consumed by the light of the full moon, it allows one's mind to temporarily merge with the multi-consciousness shared by all crows in the Zone. No one knows what happens to a fragile human mind when it is subjected to such an experience, but some speculate that this is what led the Stalker Noah to build his Arc in a desperate attempt to preserve whatever possible from the inevitable cataclysm that is about to once again fall upon this already devastated land.

Masks worn by snorks are apparently a version of GP-5, a Soviet gas mask, which was commonly used by soldiers as well as research and utility crews operating in the Zone when the second Chernobyl disaster occurred. Some of these people were working in numerous underground labouratories in which they were sealed from the outside world and exposed to tremendous amounts of radiation, which produced a creature we know as the snork. The mask, although broken beyond use (with cracked lenses and punctured filter hose), is still in demand by the scientific community. It can also be used to repair parts of outfits, but this process results in all remaining organic material being lost.

Blind dogs have many traits, much different from healthy counterparts. One of these differences - a very hardy heart, allowing the mutant for a long time to chase down its prey, until it's exhausted. Pulse when on the pursuit reaches 250 beats per minute, which is unthinkable for non-atherogenic healthy individuals of the same weight category. This endurance makes the blind dog's heart an interesting subject for study, but because of its prevalence, the rates for it among scientists are very small.

Long-term residence in radiation-contaminated territories resulted in the fact that the thyroid gland of local cats has multiplied in size. At the moment the hyperthyroidism after the change of generations is not acquired, but is a hereditary disease. Symptoms: increased food intake, increased activity, behaviour changes, nervousness, hair loss. These acquired skills are not destroyed, but rather allowed the mutated animals to quickly displace their healthy relatives and to occupy a high position in the food chain. Great interest for scientists is not due to the study of mechanisms and effects of disease.

Bloodsucker's heart have an unstudied ability - it secretes special enzymes which halt the coagulation process caused by incompatible blood types. Thanks to that, clotting does not occur even if the blood groups are different. The studies on the way this mechanism works and the composition of the enzyme will allow scientists to solve the problem of blood donor for patients with rare blood groups, as well as, probably, will open new doors for medicine.

Psi-Dogs have powerful physic abilities, for example, the ability to induce "hallucinations" upon prey. These illusions are extremely convincing, often capable of inflicting very real trauma through currently unknown means. Interestedly, scientists say that while they've identified the region of the brain responsible for the psionic abilities, it's evident that the region is "juvenile" in both development and evolutionary potential. Scientists will pay generously for samples of such tissues.

A piece of meat high in both nutrition and radiation. The scientists have enough samples already, which limits its use as a commodity. Source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING:
 
%c[default]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be carrying trichinosis or brucellosis. These diseases are transmitted by ingesting infected meat. The symptoms include fever, fatigue and appetite loss, all of which are extremely dangerous given the conditions in the Zone. Abscesses, fungal growth and tumours on the surface of the body indicate that the meat is infected and should be disposed of.

Worn manuscript in leather binding. Written by Strelok himself.\nJudging by the headings alone, it might explain some of the Zone's secrets.

'Just some notes about old men's conspiracy theories'.\n\nThere are rumours that the Agroprom Institute was used as a front for an unofficial lab in the years preceding the 2006 year accident. This lab hosted a number of very unusual experiments. The traders have dug up a lot of information about these laboratories. I met with the Barkeep, he says he sent Duty scouts to get into the underground vaults of the Dark Valley, called X-18, but they disappeared. There are another rumours regarding a 'psi-brain' mechanism. The whole neighbourhood in Yantar is under the influence of that piece of trash: it zombified everyone who came within range. There is another mechanism in the Red Forest radar underground, called lab X19, and that is what is likely to be the Brain Scorcher. There is evidence to suggest that the presence of the Brain Scorcher intentionally blocks the road to the North, but no one knows exactly what it is. The Barkeep believes that the Brain Scorcher is man-made, and these mechanisms are not always operating at full strength. He thinks there are periods when their power is lowered to cool down the apparatus. It's time to visit all the underground laboratories in the Zone and find out what kind of secrets they are hiding. Too bad, that I'm too old for this shit. I wish Strelok would be still around, but damn, he disappeared years ago.

A powerful electronic lock-pick. Strangely enough, it does not seem to be an all-purpose thieves' instrument. Rather, it seems to have been created with a specific electronic lock in mind and can't be used to override anything else.

The manuscript contains a short report on how Fang and Strelok infiltrated a hidden laboratory and their journey there. It makes mention of large Monolith presence in and around the Chernobyl NPP. More specifically under the concrete sarcophagus, also suggesting it may be their base of operations but with the intent to hide something. Reading further it states that they discovered laboratory hidden further in the north under the generators, however they were unable to gain access at the time of writing as they required the use of a decoder.

A fireproof briefcase containing military documents and reports on investigations performed near Agroprom. The reports talk in detail about how machinery and equipment has gone missing from the institute, and how the results of the investigations on their whereabouts were apparently falsified.

The report details the study of biological samples sent from lab X-18. The samples were subjected to informational field effects of varying intensities. The report meticulously describes the mutation of living beings following exposure to emissions.

The documents refer to one of the side discoveries of bio-research, specifically the discovery that living creatures are able to generate directed psy-emissions. A biological field emitter, essentially a giant brain, was grown as part of the research conducted in lab X16.

The documents describe the technical characteristics of an antenna and how they deviate from their planned designs. There is a note on the reverse side which indicates that these documents were prepared in lab X19.

The document refers to the transfer of the research team and all materials to another laboratory far in the north, which will be used to research matters relating to the influence of the noosphere. To enter the lab, use the date of the accident as the code (ddmmyyyy).\n \nThe research team comprised: N.A. Lebedev, E.F. Kalancha and V.I. Suslov.

The notebook contains a detailed description of an experiment assessing a psi-field's effect on an object in another hemisphere. A group of scientists in the Caribbean received the signal, but it was distorted. The signal was altered in a strange way, as though corrected by someone. A possible explanation is that the noosphere theory is correct and the changes were made by the noosphere.

Documents which describe the operating mechanism and main technical characteristics of a more advanced electromagnetic device.\nThere is a note inside the documents which reads: 'Documents must be returned to X8, the central laboratory. I will be busy, so deliver them yourself. � N. Lebedev'

The content of this package is unknown.

A notebook, likely owned by Strelok himself. It describes in detail how to get into an underground complex called X-18.

A flight data recorder, or a "black box". Flight recorders are used to record the status of internal systems and crew conversations, and can provide vital information in the event of an accident. In the Zone, stalker and military personnel alike are interested in these devices.
A PDA containing possible information on routes between different areas.
The document refers to what seems to be a massive radar installation. Most likely Brain Scorcher structure and operating system.
A set of old papers that refer to experiments done on rats and other animals.
Old documents that refer to an experiment related to psy-waves resonance and emitting.
A printed transcription of the radio transmission between scientist groups from the institute.
A bunch of notes, pictures and a single marked map regarding Agroprom. Probably written by Strelok himself while being around.
These documents refer to old records of transporting mechanical equipment and tools to the factory in Jupiter. It also includes geometric schemes for the tunnels toward the eastern side.
This log documents the results of an experiment happened long years ago regarding new types of psy-emitters.

Even with good supplies, it�s not uncommon to end up with one or more cartridges of what might be considered as �bad� ammunition. Unlucky stalkers might find themselves in very bad situations when their weapons jam at critical moments due to bad cartridges. On the contrary, these ammo parts can be reused for the creation of better variants. That's why some stalkers prefer to keep them around.\n \n
Torn sheets of silk coated paper. Even in a place like the Zone, it can be used for all kind of things. The cheapest way for packaging food or cleaning dirt.\n \n
Layered plastic based on fabric of fibers and polymeric binder (bakelite, polyester resin, epoxy resin). With proper skill it can be great help in repairing.\n \n
Simple cloth sheet, commonly used both to patch clothing and spread oils and cleaning solvents onto firearm mechanisms. Can be applied by any needle or glue.\n \n

Sheet of military-grade textile that can be used for field repairs of clothing and light armor. Valued for its relatively low price and high versatility, this material is commonly used by the Zoners. Medium-grade sewing equipment and advanced glue required for use. It can also be used to improve spread of liquids during weapon maintenance.\n \n

Thick textile patch reinforced with kevlar padding. Can be used to repair medium and heavy armors. Large enough to cover multiple damaged areas. High quality sewing kits and adhesives are required to make use of it. Its alternative usage is weapon lubrication and cleaning - due to increased hardness it's able reach even less accessible areas of firearm parts.\n \n

Electric capacitors can store electricity. The simplest capacitor consists of two metal plates and a dielectric between them. It is a main component is most of electrical devices due to its important job in rectifying alternative current, storing electrical energy and bypassing noise. They are quite rare in the Zone, but they are very useful.\n \n

A box of high-quality BJT transistors. A transistor consists of three Semiconductor parts (base, emitter, collector) that serve together to generate, convert and amplify electrical oscillations. The ultimate dream of electronics engineers, if such a miracle will bring to the Area.\n \n

Resistors are the most common electronics components found in electronics. They limit and direct the passage of electrical current through circuit's branches to ensure other components are getting proper voltage feeding. This box contains a good set of resistors with different resistance values and tolerance, ranging from 12 up to 82M ohms.\n \n

Electrotechnical copper wire is used practically in all devices, devices, apparatuses, installations, machines where the production, transmission or use of electric energy occurs. In its pure form it is rare, but if necessary it can be easily extracted from common old radios, walkie-talkies and other electronics.\n \n
Pieces of wide-grained, light cedar wood. Mostly used for outdoor projects such as furniture, decks and tools. White it's not that useful in a place like the Zone, it could be used in crafting.\n \n

Handful of metal bits and pieces of equipment. A variety of many different types and grades of steel and aluminum alloys. Could be used to aid in repairing gear in the field, or perhaps even in crafting.\n \n

Handful of screws, washers, nuts, nails and small pieces of metallic plates. A variety of many different types and sizes. Could be used to aid in repairing gear in the field, or perhaps even in crafting.\n \n

A small pack made of low density polyethylene film. These thin plastic membranes are used to separate areas or volumes, hold items and act as barriers. Plastic films are used in a wide variety of applications. Despite being partly torn, polyethylene's characteristics makes it a great solution for packaging and isolating, especially for food and medicine.\n \n

The very base of an outfit. These sheets are made of different materials such as cotton, polycotton, wool and leather to provide comfort and durability. Other protective fabrics are used like rubber and ballistic nylon, along with joint protections and a set of hardware and zippers.

These sheets are made of different materials such as polyester, leather and canvas, including a set of hardware and zippers. Good durability in harsh environmental conditions, which is why such materials are suitable for traveling even inside the Zone.

Sheets of military-grade textiles are often used for field clothing and light armor. Valued for its relatively low price and high versatility, this material is commonly used by the Zoners. Other protective fabrics are used like rubber and ballistic nylon, along with joint protections and a set of hardware and zippers.

These textiles that are naturally more resistant to fire than others through chemical treatment or manufactured fireproof fibers. In the Zone, such fabrics are commonly used in outfits to provide protection against hazardous environment and flame-based anomalies such as Burner and Comet.

These textiles that are more resistant to electric shock and chemical particles than others through chemical treatment or manufactured fireproof fibers. In the Zone, such fabrics are commonly used in outfits to provide protection against hazardous environment and chemical/shock-based anomalies such as Electro and Fruit Punch.
Rigid Polyvinyl Chloride ( RPVC ) is a non-flammable material that is resistant to weathering. RPVC can also be UV stabilized to provide higher protection against anomolous hazards.
Rigid Polyvinyl Chloride ( RPVC ) is a non-flammable material that is resistant to weathering. RPVC can also be UV stabilized to provide higher protection against anomolous hazards.

A tough and durable PVC coated polyester and rubber-fibre fabric designed for use in providing protection against hazards. It can be sewn, glued or welded.
		\nDouble coated material which has an extremely tough core polyester fabric and is coated on both sides with pvc.

A tough and durable PVC coated polyester and carbon-fibre fabric designed for use in providing protection against hazards. It can be sewn, glued or welded.
		\nDouble coated material which has an extremely tough core polyester fabric and is coated on both sides with pvc.

The thermal degradation behaviour of bismuth-sulfate makes it a great choice for oufits used inside the Zone. Usually coated on polymer sheets for considerable body coverage. It can provide protection against other types of hazards.

Multilayer Aluminized fabrics are specifically designed for protective apparel and shields used in environments that pose serious fire risk or safety hazards associated with radiant heat and chemical sources. In addition, these fabrics offer great isolatation against psi-waves effects.

Multilayer Aluminized fiberglass fabrics are specifically designed for protective apparel and shields used in environments that pose serious shock risk or safety hazards associated with radiant heat and chemical sources. In addition, these fabrics offer great isolatation against psi-waves effects.

PBI-blended fabrics have been trusted in the fire service over the years. Recognized as the leading high-performance protective fire resistant fabrics. For this reason, Zoners took advantage of these fabrics for their own outfits.

Kevlar k129 plates w/ reinforced ceramic inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, and are highly valued because of this feature. They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.

Tongs made from hardened steel, intended exclusively for handling artefacts. Due to specific mechanics of operation, there is no other way of removing an artefact from containers. No true artefact hunter in the Zone ever leaves the base without a similar tool.

The lead-lined metal container (LLMC) is a simple metal box with thick walls and foam inserts as well as a heavy lid with pressure-sealing mechanism. Specifically designed for transporting radioactive materials, in the Zone LLMC is most commonly employed as artefact storage and transportation device. It stops all radiation from leaking, thus ensuring safety of the user when in possession of artefacts. However, the device cannot be attached to the belt, which means that both positive and negative properties of artefacts won't apply.

		%c[ui_gray_1]Blunt knives and tools? It doesn't have to be that way. Super-practical 3 piece grindstone set for everyone, packed in a nice polyester bag. No more loose grindstone, sliding about in drawers, scratching everything - no, everything is now in its place. For perfect sharpening, three important grains for pre-grinding, sharpening and for the subsequent stripping of the blade are integrated in the set, so you can achieve a razor-sharp cutting edge.

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 

		%c[d_orange] � %c[ui_gray_2] suited for all weapons
 

		%c[ui_gray_1]Spray can containing oil intended for lubricating and protecting firearms. Frequent application will prevent guns from malfunctioning and corroding, especially after prolonged use in combat situations. Prior to lubrication process, it is advisable to properly clean the firearm to remove any foreign material that has accumulated on or inside it. One can also make use of basic tools in order to access the inner parts of a gun so as to maximize the effectiveness of maintenance. A special tuboline increases gliding quality of all movable parts making the oil even better suited for repeaters and automatic weapons. This allows guns to function even at temperatures of up to -55 �C. It has a flash point of 78 �C.
 

		%c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] technological item

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (spray lubricant)

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] high quality

		%c[d_orange] � %c[ui_gray_2] usable for repairing equipment

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 

		%c[d_orange] � %c[ui_gray_2] suited for all weapons
 

		%c[ui_gray_1]Iconic Red Army oil that has been in service for almost 70 years. The metal bottle is divided into two separate compartments, one for oil and the other one for the cleaning solvent. In the beginning, the solvent was based on an alkaline solution for effective clean-up of preservation salts in which ammunition was commonly shipped and stored. Since then, the composition of liquids has been modernized many times, but the simple yet ingenious 'double' bottle design remained unchanged. "Dvojka" is very popular in the Exclusion Zone due to its versatility. Bear in mind, however, that the oil requires adequate tools to be spread properly and so that it can reach deep into weapon's inner mechanisms. "Dvojka" should thus be regarded as more of an add-on than a stand-alone maintenance item.
 

		%c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] technological item

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] liquid gun oil and cleaning solvent

		%c[ui_gray_1]M17 is a result of a Soviet military-industrial research project intended to devise an extremely potent, single-ingredient adhesive which could be used in any situation regardless of purpose and materials involved. It was decided to use a highly potent methacrylate which is most often optimized for reacting with either plastic or metal. In case of M17, however, this limitation has been bypassed, making the substance equally effective in both areas. In addition, the adhesive received a significant boost to versatility thanks to its hydrate form: it can be diluted with water and used in any concentration depending on the intended result. There is almost no damage that the glue, combined with appropriate materials, won't be able to repair. Can be used with all materials available in the Zone.

Steel wool, also known as wire wool or wire sponge, is a bundle of strands of very fine soft steel filaments. It is used as an abrasive in finishing and repair work for polishing wood or metal objects, cleaning household cookware, and sanding in light painting. Steel wool is made from low-carbon steel (carbon content is low enough to be close to plain iron). It is not made by drawing "steel wool wire" through a tapered die, but rather by a process more like broaching where a heavy steel wire is pulled through a toothed die that removes a thin wire shaving. Bundles of steel wool can be used in precision equipment cleaning and to improve spreading of lubricants and cleaning solvents.
 

		%c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] technological item

Grease is a semi-solid lubricant. It generally consists of a soap emulsified with mineral or vegetable oil. Greases are applied to mechanisms that cannot be lubricated constantly or where typical lubricating oil would not stay in position. They also act as sealants to prevent ingress of water and incompressible materials. Grease-lubricated bearings have greater frictional characteristics due to their high viscosity.
 

		%c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] technological item

		%c[d_blue] � %c[ui_gray_2] high quality

High-quality black military shovel. Used for numerous field purposes. Training regimen of Spetsnaz soldiers covers hand-to-hand combat and use of hand-held weapons and other equipment for the purposes of eliminating enemies. One famous example is the entrenching shovel which is a formidable weapon in close combat when used by a Spetsnaz operator.

Adolf Hitler's strategic memoires collected in a single book. The book and all that it stands for are hated by many, which makes this an item of high symbolic value. Adolf Hitler (20 April 1889 - 30 April 1945) was an Austrian-born German politician and the leader of the National Socialist German Workers Party (German: Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiterpartei (NSDAP), commonly referred to as the Nazi Party). He was chancellor of Germany from 1933 to 1945 and dictator of Nazi Germany (as Fuhrer und Reichskanzler) from 1934 to 1945. Hitler is responsible for the founding of Nazism, the start of World War II, and the Holocaust.

This notebook describes various drug deals in detail. Specific nicknames, locations and time of meets. Some deals are executed through equipment exchanges and others are paid in large amounts of roubles. When browsing the pages, it becomes clear that Freedom is the main distributor of natural drugs such as marijuana. Bandits are producers and distributors of the more powerful (and dangerous) synthetic drugs like salicylic acid and cocaine. Apparently, every faction in the Zone takes part in these deals. In particular, Monolith seems to be taking in large amounts drugs in exchange for more expensive types of ammunition and equipment.

A tarpaulin (or hootch) is a large sheet of strong, flexible, water-resistant or waterproof material, often cloth such as canvas or polyester coated with urethane, or made of plastics such as polyethylene. It has reinforced grommets at the corners and along the sides to form attachment points for rope, allowing them to be tied down or suspended. Serves many purposes, but is mainly used to create small and simple tent-like hideouts. Trading value is low due to easily found alternatives.\n \n

This faction insignia depicts a sunrise against a clean blue sky, flanked by doves. It is meant to communicate the faction's desire to heal the Zone, as well as its distaste for conflict. Clear Sky has asserted an aim to gradually reduce the frequency and severity of blowouts and other anomalous cataclysms. Few stalkers believe such a thing will ever actually be possible.

This insignia pictures feathered wings in profile set against a golden sun - perhaps a symbol for the Wish Granter. The most intriguing aspect of this patch is that it is worn almost exclusively by a group perceived as brainwashed and insane. The very existence of this patch suggests that Monolith troops either retain a higher level of creativity than initially thought, or an outside force is covertly outfitting them. Monolith patches are prized among other groups, as they demonstrate the ability to fight against Monolith and live - an ability highly respected by the veterans of the Zone.

%c[ui_gray_1]PSO (for Pritsel Snaipersky Optichesky, "Optical Sniper Sight") is a series of Soviet-made optical scopes produced by Novosibirsk Instrument-Making Plant (NPZ Optics State Plant). In common use since 1964 when it was introduced as a standard issue telescopic sight for SVD sniper rifle. The scope has been later adapted to assault rifles such as AK-74 or AN-94. Recognized for its durability, versatility and very well-designed reticule pattern featuring convenient range-finder scale. This particular type has 4.0x magnification rate, making it usable mainly for combat at long ranges. It is attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount, which is standard in Warsaw Pact countries.

%c[ui_gray_1]ZF-4 is one of the first telescopic sights ever created. Designed and manufactured in Germany during World War II, it was intended to provide regular infantry with the ability to fight at long distances. In the end, due to insufficient numbers produced, it has been primarily used by German snipers and elite combat squads. The scope is still in use since weapons it has been designed for are commonly available, hence it remains a relatively popular model in the Zone as well.

%c[ui_gray_1]Advanced rifle suppressor of US design and manufacture, which has apparently 'disappeared' from one of the US Army supply containers. It consists of hi-grade steel body filled with four extension chambers, followed by a series of Z-type titanium baffles. The unit almost completely reduces muzzle flash and considerably suppresses sound emitted when firing. It also requires minimum maintenance. Suppressors of this and similar types are commonly used on all smallbore Western-made rifles and remain in active service in Western armed forces.
 
%c[d_purple] � %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] � %c[ui_gray_2] SVU rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]This specially designed three-chambered suppressor is not intended to completely silence the SVU rifle since the soldier would not be using subsonic ammunition. Its main purpose is to quiet and diffuse the noise enough to make detection by the enemy difficult. Its special feature is a very effective muzzle break placed on end of suppressor, capable of reducing recoil by about 40%. Above capabilities come at the cost of reduced muzzle velocity and thus significantly lower the weapon's damage output.
 
%c[d_purple] � %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]low

A system with additional springs and moving parts for exoskeletons and heavy armoured suits.

A hydraulic amplification system for servo drives for exoskeletons and heavy armoured suits.  \n \n
